body:
Mythic boons are special rewards given for moments of dramatic achievement. Mythic PCs should repeatedly act in a heroic fashion, charging boldly into danger with confidence, and they should be rewarded for accomplishing such astonishing feats of daring, luck, and courage. Awarding mythic boons is one way for the GM to encourage the players to push their characters to their limits.

Granting a boon is simple: when the PCs accomplish an astounding feat of bravery, cunning, or luck, they should regain one use of their mythic power (but may not exceed their total uses). This can represent different things depending on the origin: the divine smiling upon the PCs, eldritch energy surging within, or even a character's pride made manifest as actual power.

When rewarding boons, the GM should reward all the PCs involved in that moment and keep these rewards balanced across the whole group. For example, if a barbarian champion charges forward and slays a powerful villain with a lucky critical hit with his axe, you might reward the barbarian, but don't neglect the rogue trickster flanking the villain with the barbarian and the bard marshal granting bonuses on the attack roll with his bardic performance as well. A character should get a boon no more than once per encounter, but the GM might waive this guideline in special circumstances.

Included below are example moments worthy of a boon. This is not an exhaustive list, as any situation can result in an extraordinary outcome. These should not be automatic; if a character is built to perform critical hits, he shouldn't be rewarded every time he scores three or more in one combat, but only when he does so in extreme circumstances.

Many of these boons require the character to perform the task against a mythic foe, but a suitably challenging normal foe might qualify as well, as determined by the GM. Unless otherwise specified, these moments must take place within the same encounter—the indestructible boon moment doesn't count if you survive two critical hits in one combat and one in the next, for instance.
name: Mythic Boons

sections.body: With just a single melee or ranged attack, the character defeats a mythic creature that has its full hit point total.
sections.name: Assassinate

sections.body: The PCs defeat at least four or more creatures, but only one (or none) of the PCs takes any damage during the battle.
sections.name: Behind Me

sections.body: The PCs defeat a mythic foe by dealing nonlethal damage only.
sections.name: Bloodless Victory

sections.body: The character ends or prevents a combat against a mythic foe with a single skill check, most likely Diplomacy or Bluff.
sections.name: Calm Down

sections.body: The character survives a single attack that deals massive damage to her (damage equal to or greater than half her maximum hit point total, minimum 50) and exceeds the DC of the subsequent Fortitude saving throw by 5 or more.
sections.url: pfsrd://Mythic Adventures/Rules/Mythic Game/Mythic Boons/Cling to Life
sections.name: Cling to Life

sections.body: The character defeats a creature that has him entangled, grappled, or swallowed whole.
sections.name: Close Call

sections.body: The character counterspells three or more spells from a single enemy spellcaster.
sections.name: Counter Caster

sections.body: Without failing any attack rolls, the character scores three critical hits in a row.
sections.name: Critical Chain

sections.body: In 1 round, the character provokes four or more attacks of opportunity, but none of them hit.
sections.name: Deadly Dance

sections.body: The character confirms a critical hit against a mythic foe while at 0 or fewer hit points.
sections.name: Death's Door

sections.body: The character defeats a mythic foe entirely while underwater, without the aid of any spells or abilities that allow the character to breathe.
sections.name: Deep Breath

sections.body: The character starts a combat against a mythic foe without any uses of mythic power remaining (or confidence).
sections.name: Desperate Measures

sections.body: The character scores a critical hit using a ranged weapon against a target who is in the maximum range increment for the weapon.
sections.name: Distant Crit

sections.body: While at 0 hit points, the character uses a spell, item, or special ability to heal an ally instead of herself, causing her to fall unconscious and gain the dying condition.
sections.name: Final Gift

sections.body: The character defeats a mythic foe at the beginning of combat, before any other creature has a chance to act.
sections.url: pfsrd://Mythic Adventures/Rules/Mythic Game/Mythic Boons/First to Fall
sections.name: First to Fall

sections.body: The character survives taking three critical hits.
sections.name: Indestructible

sections.body: The character successfully performs at least four different combat maneuvers.
sections.name: Maneuver Display

sections.body: Using only one spell, the character defeats six or more creatures, ending the encounter.
sections.name: Mass Obliteration

sections.body: The character makes a single attack against a mythic creature that deals massive damage (equal to or greater than half its total hit points, minimum 50).
sections.name: Massive Attack

sections.body: The character deals damage to five or more creatures in a single round with melee or ranged attacks.
sections.name: Massive Swing

sections.body: Using only a single spell, item, or ability, the character heals a dying creature to full hit points.
sections.name: Master Healer

sections.body: In one day, the group defeats a number of mythic creatures with a combined total mythic tier equal to or greater than 3 × the highest mythic tier among the characters in the party.
sections.name: Mythic Challenge

sections.body: Using Bluff, the character convinces a creature of a nearly impossible lie (–20 modifier to the check).
sections.name: Outrageous Lie

sections.body: The character uses a catapult, ballista, or ram to deal massive damage to a mythic creature (equal to or greater than half the creature's total hit points, minimum 50).
sections.name: Overkill

sections.body: The character uses bardic performance to inspire its allies for 8 or more rounds.
sections.name: Performance Victory

sections.body: The character makes three successful attacks against a creature that has total concealment from him.
sections.name: Pinpoint

sections.body: The group overcomes six or more encounters without resting or regaining any abilities.
sections.name: Push On

sections.body: After sustaining a critical hit while casting a spell, the character succeeds at the concentration check and defeats a foe with that spell.
sections.name: Resilient Caster

sections.body: The creature catches an arrow or other projectile from a ranged attack and uses it to make a successful hit on the attacker within 1 round.
sections.url: pfsrd://Mythic Adventures/Rules/Mythic Game/Mythic Boons/Return to Sender
sections.name: Return to Sender

sections.body: The character succeeds at a skill check with a DC of 20 or higher when he rolled a natural 5 or lower.
sections.name: Savant

sections.body: The character casts at least one spell from each school of magic (not counting spells that are two or more levels below the highest level of spell he can cast).
sections.name: School Display

sections.body: Using path abilities, the character prevents an ally from taking any damage from an attack at least three times.
sections.name: Shield Ally

sections.body: The character exceeds the DC of a skill check by 20 or more.
sections.name: Skill Supremacy

sections.body: The character defeats a mythic creature without assistance from any allies, including animal companions, cohorts, etc.
sections.name: Solo Warrior

sections.body: The character defeats a mythic creature with a single spell on the first round of combat, before it has a chance to act.
sections.name: Swift Doom

sections.body: The group defeats an encounter in a single round.
sections.name: Swift Victory

sections.body: In 1 round, the character uses Acrobatics to move through the threatened areas of at least five foes without provoking any attacks of opportunity.
sections.name: Tumbler

sections.body: With a single use of channel energy, the character defeats eight or more undead creatures or four or more mythic undead.
sections.name: Undead Bane

sections.body: The character suffers the effects of at least three of the following conditions at the same time while in combat with a mythic foe: blinded, confused, deafened, disabled, exhausted, frightened, nauseated, paralyzed, pinned, and stunned.
sections.name: Unstoppable

sections.body: While using wild shape or some other polymorph effect, the character defeats a mythic foe.
sections.name: Wild Warrior

sections.body: The character reverses a grapple against a foe and pins that foe on the following turn.
sections.name: Wrestler
